summary: In this context, Buta-1,3-diene is mentioned as one of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that can accumulate in indoor air and is classified as a carcinogen by the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC). The discussion highlights the broader category of 'chemicals' that includes various pollutants, emphasizing the health risks associated with exposure to such harmful substances, particularly in relation to lung cancer and childhood cancers. However, the specific relationship between Buta-1,3-diene and other chemicals is not elaborated upon.
